context:
E7000MCR-xx Preassembled Rack-Mounted Paging and Intercom System
The MCR Preassembled Rack Includes:
NYQUIST E700MC |  INTRODUCTION
01
The full-featured Nyquist E7000MCR (or MCR for short) is a preassembled Nyquist E7000 system that offers ES Dealers a 
simplified installation and configuration process. Able to leverage existing facility wiring, 25-Volt speakers and call switches, 
this feature-rich, pre-rack-mounted solution provides a quick and easy migration path for legacy paging and intercom 
systems, while delivering the same powerful feature set found in the core E7000 system. The MCR is also easy to configure 
utilizing the browser-based setup wizard on the laptop PC included with the system. The Nyquist MCR is designed to 
operate as a primarily self-contained system, as it does not impose upon the customer’s network or IT department.
1 NQ-SYSCTRL Nyquist System Controller with 
DHCP Server enabled
1 - 4 NQ-E7030 ASB’s to support
24 / 48 / 72 / 96 port configurations as required
1 NQ-T1100 Admin Phone
1 NQ-E7010 I/O Controller
1 NQ-P0100 Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp
1 Cisco 16-Port Partial PoE Network Switch
(model will vary over time)
1 Dell Windows Laptop PC for system setup and 
administration (model will vary over time)
1 Locking Keyboard/Laptop Drawer
All preassembled in one 42” tall standard 19” rack 
with locking rear door, all required filler panels, 
intra-cabinet network patch cables, wire management, 
and lacing strips for field wiring.
Available Optional Add-Ons:
Automatic Failover (AF S/W License and 2nd 
NQ-SYSCTRL Nyquist System Controller)
Caster Kit
Product Features:
System ships from factory with the latest software and patches, eliminating the need to upgrade the system 
at the time of installation.
Preconfigured rack system: Roll it in, connect the speaker wiring, and finish configuring the system using 
the intuitive setup wizard on the included laptop PC and the system is up and running!
Can run as a complete free-standing system: The self-contained nature of this solution does not impose 
upon the customer’s network or IT department.
A future-proofed solution that protects your investment: Upgradeable and expandable to adapt to the school’s 
changing needs. Also, networkable to inter-connect with other Nyquist systems across the entire district.
To help deliver on our goal of providing a self-contained system, the License Activation Key (LAK) gets 
applied during factory assembly to avoid the need for an Internet connection during installation.

qas.question: What is the primary feature of the Nyquist E7000MCR system that simplifies installation?

answers.text: The primary feature that simplifies installation of the Nyquist E7000MCR system is its preassembled design, which allows for a quick setup by leveraging existing facility wiring and includes a browser-based setup wizard on a provided laptop PC. This self-contained system can be rolled in, connected to speaker wiring, and configured without imposing on the customer's network or IT department.

qas.question: How does the MCR system leverage existing facility wiring?

answers.text: The MCR system leverages existing facility wiring by utilizing 25-Volt speakers and call switches, allowing for an easy integration with legacy paging and intercom infrastructure. This feature enables quick installation without the need for extensive rewiring, simplifying the migration to the new system.

qas.question: What types of configurations can the NQ-E7030 ASB support?

answers.text: The NQ-E7030 ASB supports configurations of 24, 48, 72, or 96 ports as required. This flexibility allows it to adapt to various installation needs within the Nyquist E7000MCR system.

qas.question: What is included in the MCR preassembled rack for user setup?

answers.text: The MCR preassembled rack includes a Nyquist System Controller, multiple ASBs for port configurations, an Admin Phone, an I/O Controller, a Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp, a Cisco 16-Port Partial PoE Network Switch, a Dell Windows Laptop PC for setup, and a locking keyboard drawer, all housed in a 42” tall standard 19” rack. Additionally, it features wire management and required filler panels for easy installation.

qas.question: What connectivity option does the MCR provide to IT infrastructure?

answers.text: The MCR primarily operates as a self-contained system, which means it does not impose on the customer’s network or IT department. It is also networkable, allowing for interconnection with other Nyquist systems across the district if needed.

qas.question: How does the system ensure it is updated at the time of installation?

answers.text: The system ships from the factory with the latest software and patches pre-installed, eliminating the need for upgrades at the time of installation. This ensures that the system is up-to-date and ready for deployment without requiring an Internet connection during setup.

qas.question: What is the benefit of the License Activation Key (LAK) applied during factory assembly?

answers.text: The License Activation Key (LAK) applied during factory assembly allows for a seamless installation process by eliminating the need for an Internet connection during setup. This ensures that the system can be activated and configured right out of the box, supporting a self-contained operation without burdening the customer's network or IT department.

qas.question: What makes the Nyquist E7000MCR a future-proofed solution for schools?

answers.text: The Nyquist E7000MCR is a future-proofed solution for schools because it is upgradeable and expandable, allowing it to adapt to changing needs over time. Additionally, its networkable design enables interconnection with other Nyquist systems across the district, ensuring scalability and integration.

qas.question: Can the MCR operate independently from the customer's network?

answers.text: Yes, the MCR operates as a primarily self-contained system, meaning it does not impose on the customer's network or IT department. This allows for installation and operation without requiring an Internet connection.

qas.question: What optional add-ons are available for the MCR system?

answers.text: The optional add-ons available for the MCR system include an Automatic Failover Software License and a second NQ-SYSCTRL Nyquist System Controller, as well as a Caster Kit for mobility.

context:
NYQUIST E700MC |  NETWORK WIRING DIAGRAM
02
NQ-T110
NQ-E7010
NQ-P0100
NQ-E7030
(1-4 per system, as needed)
Laptop on
Nyquist DHCP
Network
(172.31.11.X)
NQ-SYSCTRL
Running DHCP (172.31.1.1)
Optional Connection To
Customer Network For Internet Access
16 Port (8 PoE Ports) Network Switch
Logging into the Laptop PC
NOTE: Do not connect the MCR network directly to another network because you will most likely have a DHCP conflict. 
The included Laptop PC is for configuring the MCR system and you must make sure that it is connected to the MCR 
network and that everything in the rack has been powered up to finish configuring the system. Refer to the network wiring 
diagram on page 3. The MCR network is comprised of the Nyquist System Controller and the Network Switch in the rack, 
and has been preconfigured to use the DHCP server in the Nyquist System Controller.  
16 Port (8 PoE Ports) Network Switch

qas.question: What is the IP range used for the Nyquist DHCP network?

answers.text: The IP range used for the Nyquist DHCP network is 172.31.11.X. This indicates that IP addresses assigned by the DHCP server will fall within the 172.31.11.0 to 172.31.11.255 range, excluding the specific reserved addresses.

qas.question: How many devices can be connected to the NQ-E7010 and NQ-E7030 units?

answers.text: The NQ-E7010 and NQ-E7030 units can each have 1 to 4 devices connected per system, as needed. Therefore, a maximum of 4 devices can be connected to each unit.

qas.question: What is the primary purpose of the included Laptop PC in the system setup?

answers.text: The included Laptop PC is primarily for configuring the MCR system. It must be connected to the MCR network, which includes the Nyquist System Controller and the Network Switch, to ensure proper setup and operation.

qas.question: Why should the MCR network not be directly connected to another network?

answers.text: The MCR network should not be directly connected to another network to avoid DHCP conflicts, which can occur if multiple DHCP servers are present on the same network segment. Such conflicts can disrupt the assignment of IP addresses, leading to connectivity issues for devices on the MCR network.

qas.question: What type of ports does the 16 Port Network Switch include?

answers.text: The 16 Port Network Switch includes 8 PoE (Power over Ethernet) ports. These ports allow for the simultaneous transmission of data and electrical power to connected devices.

qas.question: What is the IP address of the DHCP server in the Nyquist System Controller?

answers.text: The IP address of the DHCP server in the Nyquist System Controller is 172.31.1.1. This server manages the DHCP for the MCR network, which includes the Nyquist System Controller and the connected devices.

qas.question: Which component in the MCR network is responsible for DHCP configuration?

answers.text: The Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL) is responsible for DHCP configuration in the MCR network. It runs the DHCP server with an IP address of 172.31.1.1, which manages IP assignments for devices on the network.

qas.question: How should the equipment in the rack be prepared before configuring the system?

answers.text: Before configuring the system, ensure that all equipment in the rack is powered up and that the included Laptop PC is connected to the MCR network. This network comprises the Nyquist System Controller and the Network Switch, which is preconfigured to use the DHCP server in the Nyquist System Controller.

context:
NYQUIST E700MC |  LOGGING INTO THE LAPTOP PC
03
If you want to connect the MCR system to the customer’s network (for say Internet access or remote administration), that is 
done by connecting the customer’s network to port “B” of the System Controller.
To log into the laptop PC, use Username “bogen” with the Password “bogen001” (using zeros not the letter “o”). When the 
MCR system was being assembled at the factory, we installed the SSL certificate onto the laptop PC so that you don’t have 
to. You can launch the Edge browser and go to System Controller’s IP address of 172.31.1.1 and you will be presented with 
the Dialing Length Wizard, and you will then need to complete the setup wizards and then log into the system and continue 
with the system configuration (e.g., adding stations, zones, etc.).
For more information on how to properly configure a system refer to the Nyquist E7000 eLearning course.
Things you don’t need to worry about with the MCR is that the License Activation Key (LAK) and Customer Information has 
already been populated in the system to save you time. We recommend that you go to the Product License page in System 
Parameters and take note your LAK for future reference/use.
Network Port “A” for
MCR Network Only
Network Port “B” for Connection
to Customer’s Network

qas.question: What is the username and password to log into the laptop PC?

answers.text: The username to log into the laptop PC is "bogen" and the password is "bogen001" (using zeros, not the letter "o").

qas.question: Which port connects the MCR system to the customer’s network?

answers.text: Port "B" of the System Controller connects the MCR system to the customer’s network for purposes such as Internet access or remote administration. Port "A" is designated for MCR Network Only.

qas.question: What is the IP address to access the System Controller?

answers.text: The IP address to access the System Controller is 172.31.1.1. You can use this address in the Edge browser to access the Dialing Length Wizard and continue with the system configuration.

qas.question: What should you do after logging into the Edge browser on the laptop PC?

answers.text: After logging into the Edge browser on the laptop PC, navigate to the System Controller’s IP address of 172.31.1.1, which will present you with the Dialing Length Wizard. Complete the setup wizards, log into the system, and proceed with the configuration, such as adding stations and zones.

qas.question: Where can you find your License Activation Key in the system?

answers.text: You can find your License Activation Key (LAK) on the Product License page in the System Parameters of the MCR system. It is recommended to take note of it for future reference/use.

qas.question: What network is connected through Port “A”?

answers.text: Network Port "A" is used for the MCR network only, which is separate from the customer's network. This means that any connections made through Port "A" do not provide access to the external customer network.

qas.question: What type of certificate was pre-installed on the laptop PC?

answers.text: The SSL certificate was pre-installed on the laptop PC during the MCR system's assembly at the factory. This allows for secure connections when accessing the System Controller's IP address without needing any further setup.

qas.question: What course is recommended for more information on system configuration?

answers.text: The recommended course for more information on system configuration is the Nyquist E7000 eLearning course. It provides guidance on properly configuring the system, including adding stations and zones.

qas.question: What does the Dialing Length Wizard assist with during the setup?

answers.text: The Dialing Length Wizard assists in configuring the dialing parameters of the MCR system during setup. It helps ensure that the system correctly processes dialing patterns for phone calls by allowing the user to specify the required dialing lengths and formats.

qas.question: What has already been populated in the MCR system to save time?

answers.text: The License Activation Key (LAK) and Customer Information have already been populated in the MCR system to save time. You should check the Product License page in System Parameters to note your LAK for future reference.
